summary: Audit and debug an existing website in the Caffeine project to resolve layout/content/link/JS/functionality issues site-wide, and update the Admin access flow to grant access with code 7583A and redirect to a fully functional Admin Dashboard.

existing_features.title: Perform a full-site audit and fix all runtime errors, broken navigation/links, layout overlaps, styling conflicts, and script/JS conflicts across every page and component. Ensure consistent text rendering from the header navigation through the footer (including the hamburger menu), with no overlapping elements, broken responsive states, or console errors during normal navigation and interactions.

Fix the mismatch between navigation links and router paths so that the top navigation and footer links always load the intended pages. In particular, ensure the “Lore & Knowledge” navigation item routes to the actual Lore page route (currently implemented as BlogLore).

Update the header navigation so the user can click an explicit “Admin” item in the top navigation (desktop and mobile hamburger menu). This must open the Admin access screen (/admin-access). Keep existing lockout behavior (hide/disable Admin entry when locked out), but ensure the entry point is clearly labeled “Admin” as requested.

Update the Admin access screen to match the requested flow: after clicking “Admin”, the form label must read “Administrator Access”, the action button must read “Submit”, and when the user enters access code 7583A and submits, the UI must display “Access Granted” and immediately redirect to the Admin Dashboard (/admin) without an artificial delay.

Ensure the Admin Dashboard (/admin) loads reliably after a successful access code submission and that all dashboard sections render without broken components, missing imports, empty/blank views, or runtime errors. Any sections that are not backed by implemented backend functionality must still render a stable UI state without throwing and must not appear “broken” (no empty files rendered, no crashes, no unresolved promises).

Run and apply the project’s manual QA checklist for navigation & mobile menu, admin access, and core pages, and address any issues discovered during that pass (including responsive layout regressions and focus/keyboard usability issues that cause functional problems). Use the existing QA plan document as the baseline.

new_feature_requests.summary: Perform full-site audit and debugging: fix bugs/errors, broken links, layout/styling overlaps, script conflicts/JS errors; ensure all pages load correctly and navigation (including hamburger menu) and interactive features work smoothly; verify consistent text display from header to footer.

Update Admin flow: clicking “Admin” opens access screen; entering code 7583A and submitting shows “Access Granted” then immediately redirects to a fully functional Admin Dashboard UI with all intended admin tools/features and no broken/missing components.

projectName: Full-site QA/debug pass + fix Admin access redirect to working Admin Dashboard
